---
title: "package.json"
---

## High-level description
This `package.json` file defines the configuration and metadata for the `fs-constants` npm package. The package aims to provide a way to require filesystem constants across both Node.js and browser environments.

## Symbols

### Package Metadata
#### Description
The package metadata includes essential information about the `fs-constants` package.

#### Internal Logic
- Name: `fs-constants`
- Version: `1.0.0`
- Description: "Require constants across node and the browser"
- Main entry point: `index.js`
- Browser-specific entry point: `browser.js`
- Author: Mathias Buus (@mafintosh)
- License: MIT

### Repository
#### Description
Specifies the version control repository for the package.

#### Internal Logic
- Type: git
- URL: https://github.com/mafintosh/fs-constants.git

### Issues and Homepage
#### Description
Provides links for reporting issues and the package's homepage.

#### Internal Logic
- Bugs/Issues URL: https://github.com/mafintosh/fs-constants/issues
- Homepage: https://github.com/mafintosh/fs-constants

## Dependencies
The package has no runtime dependencies or development dependencies listed.

## Configuration
The package.json file defines the following configuration:

| Option | Type | Value | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:------|:------------|
| main | string | "index.js" | The main entry point for Node.js environments |
| browser | string | "browser.js" | The entry point for browser environments |

This configuration suggests that the package provides different implementations for Node.js and browser environments, allowing it to work across both platforms.
